text:
Hey guys,

I had a doubt regarding the external tracking and ad scripts used on a website with HubSpot cookie consent.

So HubSpot says if we are using external scripts then we need to use the cookie scanner (beta) to categorize them in order to block them accordingly in the future. My question is, is the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/cookie-banner#block-third-party-cookies-manually|cookie consent banner api> supposed to do the same thing without cookie scanner (beta)? Maybe it was later HubSpot released the cookie scanner to automate and get rid of the manual work? and one could of course choose between either of the options. Let me know if I'm wrong xD

Thank you in advance

#cookieconsent <#CCQ7H31D5|developer-tools> #cookiescanner
Anyone know how to access developer mode in the page editor in the beta experience? The query string does not seem to be changing anything

Hello!

I’m trying to put a HubSpot CRM iframe inside Twilio Flex!
I would like to have the entire HubSpot interface for my agents inside of Twilio Flex
I know HubSpot’s own team did this, however I don’t know if this iframe is available to any customers or if it’s something just for their internal team.
Thanks

I think, if you don't use Cookie Scanner (beta), then the best practice is to use the  `'addPrivacyConsentListener'` callback function to conditionally load your third party scripts that drop 3rd-party cookies
Its one or the other then right? Of course it depends on how much of a beta the cookie scanner is too lol

Yeah, with the cookie scanner you can achieve the same thing without setting up the javascript handling. I have not thoroughly tested the new Cookie scanner, so I can't say to how well it's working, but worth giving a try for sure!

Perfect!! Thanks a lot <@U03KAK3R4GY>
Appreciate it :blush:

Let me clarify:
1. The issue above ocurried on firefox
2. On the chrome browser works fine, but some screens doesnt work well, like screens with "ui extensions"
About item 2, I got this error:

Hello everyone,
I have issue on search result page, when search any keyword then search module return wrong description for all the posts

using this code
```var SEARCH_URL = '/_hcms/search?',
requestUrl = SEARCH_URL + searchParams + '&analytics=false',
request = new XMLHttpRequest();
request.open('GET', requestUrl, true);```
